channel.title: Css on DIYDeveloper.io
channel.description: Recent content in Css on DIYDeveloper.io

item.title: My first few hours with Visual Studio Code
item.description: Microsoft have released a new editor. This is Microsoft’s take on Sublime/Atom. It looks nice, it feels fast, and it can run on OSX or Linux (as well as Windows). I’ve been using it for work this morning - here are my impressions.

item.title: Accidental NPM Packaging (and JSPM!)
item.description: Last week I created a package - an NPM. I didn’t intend to. I just wanted to use the Microsoft Signal-R javascript client, and I was surprised to see it wasn’t listed in the Node package repository.

item.title: Animating Aurelia
item.description:
Have you heard of Aurelia? It’s Rob Eisenberg’s new framework. If you travelled forward in time two years and wrote a framework based on cutting edge tech, Aurelia would be the result. Aurelia is built on technology so new that the standards haven’t been ratified yet. I’m talking ES6, ES7, transpiling, a proper module loader, lambda expressions (arrow functions), computed properties, and more.

Now let’s use this massively powerful framework to animate a few boxes.

item.title: Yes, the doc-type is still important
item.description: or… “why don’t my before/after pseudo elements work in IE8?”. It may be 2014, but doc types still matter.

item.title: Quick mobile optimisation for your blog
item.description: Here are some quick changes to make your blog (or other site) more readable on mobile devices. TLDR: viewport and mediaqueries.
